summary: This is an email from Rebekah Hill, a legal assistant at Sasser Law Firm, to a client regarding a Chapter 7 bankruptcy case. It informs the client that a motion was filed to excuse their appearance from a 341 Meeting of Creditors and provides instructions for completing and notarizing interrogatory documents. The document appears to be a routine bankruptcy case communication, not directly related to the Epstein case.

persons.name: Rebekah Hill
persons.context: Sends an email to a client regarding a Chapter 7 bankruptcy case, instructing them on procedures for a 341 Meeting of Creditors.

persons.name: Ms. Smith
persons.context: Addressed in the email as the recipient; the client in a Chapter 7 bankruptcy case who needs to complete interrogatories.

connections.description: Rebekah Hill, representing Sasser Law Firm, is providing legal instructions to client Ms. Smith regarding her bankruptcy case.

events.title: 341 Meeting of Creditors
events.description: A scheduled meeting in a Chapter 7 bankruptcy case for which a motion was filed to excuse the client's appearance.

keyFacts: The document is an email dated August 9, 2019, from Rebekah Hill of Sasser Law Firm.
It concerns a Chapter 7 bankruptcy case for a client named Ms. Smith.
A motion was filed to excuse the client's appearance from a 341 Meeting of Creditors scheduled for August 5, 2019.
The client is instructed to complete, notarize, and return interrogatory documents.
The document appears to be unrelated to Jeffrey Epstein or his associates; it is routine bankruptcy correspondence.
